item.description:
Worcester Art Museum – Photography Workshop – This Fall

Lighting with Portable Flash
Lou Swinand, instructor

4 Sessions -----
Friday 6 – 8 pm 10/15/10 to 11/05/10
$60 WAM members/$85 non-members

Portable flash units are powerful and versatile lighting tools. Learn how to control and modify the light coming from them to creatively light your subject.

On-camera flash is flat and unflattering. This workshop will show you how to get more from your flash by using modifiers and by using your portable flash off the camera. It will demonstrate how to use I, 2 and even 3 flash units to light a scene.

Learn about various remotes used to trigger the off-camera flash; as well as how to apply light modifiers, such as diffusers, umbrellas, softboxes, and reflectors, which soften and shape the light. The workshop information applies to digital and film cameras.

To register contact the Worcester Art Museum Education Department: 508-793-4333 or www.worcesterart.org

For more information about the course contact Lou: photography_2@hotmail.com

group.name: Worcester Alliance of Photographers - AKA: WAP

item.name: Lighting with Portable Flash Photography Workshop- Worcester Art Museum
